results.abstract: Soyuz space capsule crewmen Russian Nikolai M Budarin and Americans Capt Kenneth D Bowersox and Dr Donald R Pettit meet with news media, Moscow; shrug off concerns about their steep plunge to Earth in malfunctioning spaceship and off-target landing; Russian Space Agency has set up panel to probe flawed re-entry; photo (M)

headline.main: Soyuz Crew Shrugs Off Rocky Plunge From Space

results.snippet: Offering a multinational display of right-stuff bravura, the three-man crew of the Soyuz space capsule met the news media today and shrugged off the notion that their steep plunge to Earth in a malfunctioning spaceship last Sunday was riskier than...
results.lead_paragraph: Offering a multinational display of right-stuff bravura, the three-man crew of the Soyuz space capsule met the news media today and shrugged off the notion that their steep plunge to Earth in a malfunctioning spaceship last Sunday was riskier than any other weekend drive. The astronauts, two Americans and a Russian, clad in identical blue coveralls, spent 40 minutes talking about the sweet smell of Kazakhstan earth after five and a half months in space, the strangeness of slithering out of their capsule with muscles that had forgotten gravity and the joy of seeing their wives.

results.abstract: A O Scott reviews movie Down With Love, Peyton Reed's homage to Rock Hudson-Doris Day comedies of late 1950's and mid-1960's; Renee Zellweger and Ewan McGregor star, with David Hyde Pierce in Tony Randall's old role as foil, and Randall himself in cameo; photo (M)

headline.main: Trading Barbs, Like Doris And Rock

results.snippet: Rock Hudson and Doris Day starred in only three movies together, but their names are forever conjoined in the cultural memory, signifying the guilty pleasures of a supposedly more innocent era. The comedies they made for Universal from the late...
results.lead_paragraph: Rock Hudson and Doris Day starred in only three movies together, but their names are forever conjoined in the cultural memory, signifying the guilty pleasures of a supposedly more innocent era. The comedies they made for Universal from the late 1950's to the mid-60's -- with each other and with surrogates ranging from Cary Grant to Gina Lollobrigida -- were the product of a moment when the incipient sexual revolution collided with the moribund Hollywood Production Code in an explosion of bright color, lush music and naughty innuendo. These entertainments (''Pillow Talk,'' ''Lover Come Back'' and ''Send Me No Flowers'') were at once dopey and ingenious, wholesome and sophisticated, teasing their audiences, as the romantic principals teased each other, by pretending to be what they were not: subversive when they were in fact conventional, and vice versa.

results.abstract: Dr Kenneth D Bowersox and Capt Donald R Pettit, American astronauts who have completed stressful 5 1/2-month stay aboard International Space Station, and returned to Earth on Russian Soyuz capsule, are adjusting to life on ground, and coping with Columbia space shuttle catastrophe (M)

headline.main: Stressful Space Trip Over, Americans Adjust in Russia

results.snippet: Whenever conditions became stressful aboard the International Space Station, Capt. Kenneth D. Bowersox put on a tie, ''a really ugly tie.''    The captain, the station skipper, had taken the tie with him in case he needed cheering up during the long...
results.lead_paragraph: Whenever conditions became stressful aboard the International Space Station, Capt. Kenneth D. Bowersox put on a tie, ''a really ugly tie.'' The captain, the station skipper, had taken the tie with him in case he needed cheering up during the long stay in space. He said it would remind him of his buddies at their desks below, wearing their ties.

byline.original: All summer movie listings were written by Anita Gates; Compiled with the assistance of Suzanne O'Connor

results.lead_paragraph: Dates are subject to change. June 4 THE WEATHER UNDERGROUND -- Looking back at the 70's and the radical antiwar, antiracism, anticapitalism offshoot of S.D.S. (Students for a Democratic Society). Bernardine Dohrn, Mark Rudd and Todd Gitlin are among the interview subjects in this documentary by Sam Green and Bill Siegel. June 6 THE EYE -- (''Jian Gui'') A supernatural thriller from the Pang brothers, Oxide and Danny, who did ''Bangkok Dangerous.'' In this multigenre film, a young woman (Lee Sin-je) who has been blind for 18 years receives a corneal transplant and, as a result, can see again. There is a nasty side effect, though: she sees ghosts and monsters and seems to be able to predict people's deaths. With Lawrence Chou, Chutcha Rujinanon and Candy Lo.

results.abstract: Director Peyton Reed and writer Eve Ahlert create Down With Love, movie starring Renee Zellweger that embraces values and visual style of bedroom comedies of 1960's; interviews; photo (M)
results.snippet: IN its swinging Manhattan nightclubs, the showgirls wear astronaut helmets. Every apartment in the city comes with a balcony, a fireplace and a picture-perfect backdrop of moonlit skyscrapers. The battle of the sexes is still being played with rubber...
results.lead_paragraph: IN its swinging Manhattan nightclubs, the showgirls wear astronaut helmets. Every apartment in the city comes with a balcony, a fireplace and a picture-perfect backdrop of moonlit skyscrapers. The battle of the sexes is still being played with rubber bullets. And up in their park-view aeries, fragrant women step from their bubble baths into their fluffy, high-heeled slippers, dripping suds as they scamper -- yes, scamper -- across the marble floor. ''What I like about it, and what I hope other people will like about it, is that there is no attempt to make the movie look realistic or to make it gritty,'' said the director Peyton Reed. ''All the apartments and the wardrobes do not have that lived-in look. No wear-and-tear. No wrinkles. Our movie is the idea of New York City as seen through the lens of a 1960's Hollywood movie camera.''

results.abstract: Peter M Nichols Taking the Children review of movies Daddy Day Care, Down With Love and The Matrix Reloaded; photo (S)

headline.main: Men Without Paychecks, Now Minding the Children

results.snippet: Daddy Day Care  Eddie Murphy, Jeff Garlin, Steve Zahn, Regina King, Khamani Griffin, Anjelica Huston  Directed by Steve Carr  PG 93 minutes      Trying to promote a vegetable-based breakfast cereal called Veggios, the marketing man Charlie Hinton...
results.lead_paragraph: Daddy Day Care Eddie Murphy, Jeff Garlin, Steve Zahn, Regina King, Khamani Griffin, Anjelica Huston Directed by Steve Carr PG 93 minutes Trying to promote a vegetable-based breakfast cereal called Veggios, the marketing man Charlie Hinton (Mr. Murphy) winds up on unemployment. Charlie has a Mercedes convertible and a nice house. Soon he will have a monthly day care bill that his wife, Kim (Ms. King), at first mistakes for an annual rate. Chapman Academy is expensive, but the 4-year-olds wear blazers and learn German. The headmistress, Miss Harridan (Ms. Huston), assures the Hintons that there is no more enriching place for their son, Ben (Khamani Griffin).
